title: Boosted Time Tracker
description: Achieve more by improving your productivity with the Boosted - Productivity & Time Tracker app. Understand your habits with insightful reports and improve your productivity and time management with various productivity tools like the Pomodoro timer and simple time tracking. Understanding is the first step to progress Improving your habits is the shortest path to self-improvement. The most effective way to do this is to understand them first. By tracking your time, you'll be able to understand your current habits and you'll be able to use this knowledge to build better ones. Time tracking should be as effortless as possible To spend the day effectively, you need to invest your time wisely. By using the productivity and time management tools in Boosted, you can make better use of your time. We are constantly striving to make Boosted as simple as possible so that it works for you and not the other way around. Effortless time tracking - that's our goal. Let's start the change We want to help you reach your goals and we believe Boosted is a great tool for that. That's why we are constantly improving the app so you can have an awesome experience on your journey of self-improvement. Here are some of the key features that Boosted gives you: ‚òÖ Single click time tracking for all of your activities ‚òÖ Stay organized by splitting your projects into smaller tasks ‚òÖ Pomodoro timer, countdown timer, and many other productivity tools ‚òÖ Export your data to CSV ‚òÖ Control your time tracking quickly from the notification bar ‚òÖ Keep your data safe with Google Drive backups ‚òÖ View detailed reports and statistics of all your tracked time ‚òÖ View all of your tracked activities in a calendar ‚òÖ Stay productive even at night with the Dark mode ‚òÖ No ads - stay focused without unnecessary distractions We value your privacy. Boosted doesn't store any of your personal data on our servers. All the time tracking data is stored on your phone. You can optionally backup your data to a private folder in your Google Drive. These backups will only be accessible by the Boosted app. You can also export your data to a CSV file and you will have full control over where that will be stored. We love feedback! You can always contact us at app.boosted@gmail.com if you have any questions or if you want something new in the app. We listen to all the feedback we get from you because we want to create an app that fits your needs! Take control of your time by installing Boosted for FREE!
descriptionHTML:
Achieve more by improving your productivity with the Boosted - Productivity & Time Tracker app. Understand your habits with insightful reports and improve your productivity and time management with various productivity tools like the Pomodoro timer and simple time tracking.

Understanding is the first step to progress
Improving your habits is the shortest path to self-improvement. The most effective way to do this is to understand them first. By tracking your time, you'll be able to understand your current habits and you'll be able to use this knowledge to build better ones.

Time tracking should be as effortless as possible
To spend the day effectively, you need to invest your time wisely. By using the productivity and time management tools in Boosted, you can make better use of your time.

We are constantly striving to make Boosted as simple as possible so that it works for you and not the other way around. Effortless time tracking - that's our goal.

Let's start the change
We want to help you reach your goals and we believe Boosted is a great tool for that. That's why we are constantly improving the app so you can have an awesome experience on your journey of self-improvement.

Here are some of the key features that Boosted gives you:
‚òÖ Single click time tracking for all of your activities
‚òÖ Stay organized by splitting your projects into smaller tasks
‚òÖ Pomodoro timer, countdown timer, and many other productivity tools
‚òÖ Export your data to CSV
‚òÖ Control your time tracking quickly from the notification bar
‚òÖ Keep your data safe with Google Drive backups
‚òÖ View detailed reports and statistics of all your tracked time
‚òÖ View all of your tracked activities in a calendar
‚òÖ Stay productive even at night with the Dark mode
‚òÖ No ads - stay focused without unnecessary distractions


We value your privacy.
Boosted doesn't store any of your personal data on our servers. All the time tracking data is stored on your phone.

You can optionally backup your data to a private folder in your Google Drive. These backups will only be accessible by the Boosted app.

You can also export your data to a CSV file and you will have full control over where that will be stored.

We love feedback!
You can always contact us at app.boosted@gmail.com if you have any questions or if you want something new in the app. We listen to all the feedback we get from you because we want to create an app that fits your needs!


Take control of your time by installing Boosted for FREE!
summary: Track your activities and take control of your time!

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using Boosted daily for over six months. I can't imagine life without it. As a billable employee at a consultancy, this keeps me sane and makes it easy to track hours weekly. Simple interface, easy to edit missed/incorrect entries. Took a few weeks to learn all the things I can do with it, but it was already useful on day 1. Don't accidentally delete a project/category--I learned that lesson the hard way! Wish it could be undone for a certain amount of time afterwards.

So far I am loving this app. It has given me a sense of clarity on how I use my time. It's honest, very eye opening and it helps me use my time more wisely. I do have 1 complaint. That being you can't track more than 1 thing at a time. If you try to do so, it will stop your previous timer and start the next. What if I want to track my audio book listening time while also doing art or working out?i can't do that and accurately track my time. It's a little frustrating but I still like it.

I like it so far but I really wish I had the option to be tracking more than one thing at once (for example, I'm a freelancer paid by the job trying to track how much time I spend finding work vs actually working and sometimes those things sort of overlap). Maybe that's a paid feature idk. Also the interface has a steep learning curve, it's a bit too minimal imo, things are hard to find at first. But all around very nice and I'm mainly here for the data, which is excellent :)

Great app. I wish they would add a larger start and stop button on my phone drop down menu. Even better, if the phone is opened in lock mode, it would be great to be able to just hit stop when I get up to take a break and then start without having to punch in my phone code. Still gets 5 stars cuz its pretty dang easy to use and the charts are pretty fancy.

Great way to track activitiies and tasks. It is not quite refined yet. The buttons are difficult to press. It takes too many clicks to get to the main features. And worst, there is no way to export the data. Exporting is very necessary because the built in features for sorting, viewing, and analyzing the tracked tasks is very lacking. There is no way to zoom to a single day or sum the time spent on a single task over a week.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ricky and thank you for your review. We are open to any new suggestions. The export data feature will be available in the very next update. Have a productive day.

scraped_reviews.content: Excellent, it's like a fitness tracker smart watch but it tracks so much more!!! It tracks whatever you'd like it to down to the second so you're able to see what you're spending your day doing. And you can be as specified or as broad as you want when it comes to labeling various projects. Opinion of it might change later. I'll keep you posted. But until then, I love it!

This is the best productivity tracker. I use it every day and tells me what I spend most of my time on from multiple periods of time. It is also ad-free, which is one reason why I kept this app. A feature I would like would be implemented would be that if I open a 3rd party app, boosted would be able to automatically track him much time I spend on that app, so I don't have to input it manually. Overall, a great app

The app is simple, and that's exactly how I want it. I use it to keep track of how long I write and how often and the visible graphs help keep me motivated. I use the free version of the app and I am not bombarded by ads like on other free apps. The only thing I can think of that would make it better would be a widget I could put on the home page. It'd be nice to see a graph of my progress right when I open my phone and to be able to start a timer on some preselected projects from the home age.

easy to set up new projects, break it into smaller tasks if needed - and to edit or add a record if i forgot to start tracking! i'm using it to keep track of how long my knitting projects take - i'm often stopping to check messages or do a few chores, so while i may be "working" for 4 hours, there's usually many mini-breaks. MUCH simpler than Knit Companion as i don't need to count rows & pattern specifics.

First off: I love the app and I am super excited to continue using it. Very clean looking and I like the statistics that are given. One thing I really hope for in the future is a streamlining of the ability to add records manually. I often find myself looking at the calendar to check to see if I have any gaps in my tracking (as I track 24/7). What I would really LOVE is if I could HIGHLIGHT a part of the calendar and assign it a project instead of having to remember the start and end of the gap

Very good app. Need a better way to deal with 2 activities at once (e.g. exercising and listening to a book). It looks like they can maybe be inputted manually, but the ability to run simultaneous clocks is needed. And ability to organize the order of projects on the selection screen so I can put them in order of best to worst. Also, more colors would help to differentiate projects (e.g. with the choice of colors with stripes or other pattern). Widgets and a manual when you can too please. Thx!

The UI is smooth and pleasing but lacking in functionality. Because each time you want to record a new entry you will have to go select a project and then a task if needed then start the clock. You cannot add a unlabeled record. Another lacking aspect is chart choices and location, and the minimalistic color palette available for the free version. Lastly, the calendar design is impractical and hard to follow. Overall Good app, but there are a couple other better choices out there.

I LOVE this app!! I downloaded it on my Samsung phone to keep track of my work hours, because of having to with remotely for the COVID-19 crisis. I can track how much time I spend on different projects, and it helps me avoid working too many hours, which is easy for me to do when working from home. Super easy to set up, navigate and use.

This app works really well. Out of the five time tracking apps I tried, this one felt the most intuitive with the most amount of easy data reporting. If you're looking for a time tracker, give this one a try. The one time fee for pro is well worth while. However, I am a little disappointed there is no online app (or maybe even an iOS app) and a way to sync time across devices. Google Calendar integration that could make events or follow your calendar tasks would be especially useful too.

This app helped me track my GRE study and productivity time. (FYI, I encourage everyone to study a solid 60 hours for the test. I tracked 40 hours myself and felt another 20 would be sufficient. This type of data is helpful.) Currently, I use it to track the time I spend on self-care. I wish there were more colors for the categories, but I think that's my only complaint. The app keeps me accountable without being overbearing. Thank you

This app works as expected and is pretty straightforward. Consistent and not glitchy. One star taken off due to lack of ability to take notes on completed time entries. Sometimes you might want to input a quick little note or bit of detail to help you remember the exact work you did when you go to fill out your time card or invoice your customer. Even a short text field would be helpful.

The primary reason I gave this a lower scores is that you're only allowed to activate one timer at a time. Also, there is no option to add notes or descriptions to the tasks. There is no widget. Despite that, I like that there are projects with individual tasks. I like that each one of those tasks has a timer. The statistics reports are very helpful. My favorite feature is the ability to add a time record if you missed it earlier.

Nice experience, and time tracked events can be changed and linked to take at will which is nice. However, the app has some major limitations. I have 2 feature requests in order of importance: 1: On the reports page, allow me to select a start and end date rather than merely "last X days". 2: I'd like to be able to export my data into a CSV or similar.

It times your tasks so you know how long it takes you but there are no presets so everything has to be manually inserted. I found that I always forgot to stop the timer and also studies show that if you have your phone even in the same room as you, you're likely to grab it and get distracted by social media. I would just stick to a paper daily scheduler or use your computer timer and Google calendar.

This is really underwhelming, even with the paid options‚Ä¶ Compared to 'Simple Timer' app, which I have been testing along side this app, 1stly, SIMPLE TIMER is completely free, fully customizable and has a fab Wear OS companion app (also free). with Boosted I couldn't even export the CSV without very little options, then ran into an unable to save error. So yes it's a clean app, but there are MUCH better ones for free.

Incredible app. Tailored to most of my time tracking needs. I've been using it for over 3 years and found it simple yet truly flexible. But it's missing a few key features like the ability to sync across multiple devices. This has put me in a spot as I bought the app but my phone has conked off and now I can't uninstall it from the older device nor add my new device to it. Moreover, I need to set up my projects all again and can't access my old records. That's quite difficult to do.

Beautiful and simple. Only downside is that there isn't any way to add notes. I use this to study and would like to note(small note of 100-200 cases, nothing too long) pages and chapters, would help me track my progress way better. It's a time tracker, but not productivity without it imo. Still love it though, very clean and much simpler interface than other time trackers.

Fantastic, it does everything you'll want from a time tracking app. Clean and simple interface. If it would be possible in the reports view to select and see the stats over a specific time period (e.g. 1 july to 30 july), then it would get 5 stars. Seeing stats for the stats for the last 7/30/365 days from today is helpful, but limiting because it's always counting from today, and therefore a comparison of specific time periods is not possible. Is this a feature you could be integrating?

It is easy how to use it. I appreciate that it can track and record time spent in each task. I continue to practice having a sense of urgency. This app keeps me from being idle and makes my motor running. I am able to see and think of other things that i can do and add to my daily activity. With this i am establishing a routine that keeps me busy throughout the day. I am boosted.

Love the app that I immediately bought premium. It's easy to use. I wish there was a search function to easily find projects especially if you have lots. A one button press to go to timeline, reports etc. would be nice, not having to click 2 times. I know the theme is minimalist, but there is a lot of real estate beside the the three-line button. Anyway, love the app!

Great app, one of the best productivity timers ive used. I give only four stars for two reasons: Firstly, as others have mentioned I too despise the subscription format, I would much rather pay a higher price once, than keep a subscription going. And secondly, I would love if my notification settings would automatically change when im in a session, i.e. when i start a session my phone goes silent or into do not disturb. Would love if you could add that

I absolutely love it! It is free, well-designed and beautiful productivity app. It doesn't have unnecessary features, like others, while it has almost everything what everyone needs. I would like to be able to sync my data across multiple devices. Themes support would also be nice, like dark and pitch black variants. I wish you success in development!

Really great app overall. Only thing that's missing that I would really like would be the ability to group projects together (or tag them), and to filter on these groups in the reports section. Because I mostly want to use this app for work productivity, so that is mainly what I want to see in the reports, but at the same time I want to track various interesting stats like time spent playing sports, or on a certain videogame, etc. Colors kind of do this, but not really.

Excellent UI and feature choice. Most devs don't understand the needs of the user: they organize their apps poorly and fill them with useless features, while failing to provide the useful ones. My only concern is the backup: I don't see any files added to my Google Drive, even though the backup seems to somehow work. While I have tested recovering my data after uninstalling and reinstalling the app, I'm worried that I'll lose everything if my phone dies. EDIT: concern addressed! :)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Detached and thank you for your feedback. Your data is securely stored in private space on Google Drive. You can see Boosted app in your Google Drive settings - manage apps. Have a productive day!

scraped_reviews.content: I like the app in general, but there is one big downside: I'd like to be able to delete all previous entries (either all at once or some inidivdual ones). I stopped using the app for a while and the fact that my tracking was inconsistent over time makes me frustrated and I want data tracking to start over completely. Also, I left tracking turned on on accident once or twice which is why I have inaccurate hours long entries that I can't erase. I need the delete button!

The best productivity app I have ever had. I became a premium user just a few days after downloading it for it's one of the best apps I've ever used. I would ask for two more features, though: 1) A way to recover deleted entries, since it's possible to delete one accidentally; 2) Subtasks. Just so I can be more specific about my doings. Example: inside a task named "Mathematics", to be able to create subtasks with the name of the subjects I am studying; "Trigonometry", "Calculus", etc.

This app really helps me understanding my velocity of doing things. I am obsessive about tracking daily life. This really helps me track the things and make a journal out of my life. It would have been much better if there is another field to add optional comments. Use case would be something like if I read for 20 min, I would mention number of pages I read during that session. Great work!

Best productivity app. I just hope that it gets regular updates & the developer, who has done such a great job, doesn't just abandon it. Will gladly pay for a paid version, if it helps support their work. My main suggestion: please integrate a Pomodoro timer into the app - so we can track projects in x-minute increments as well, instead of one whole block. Also, please add support for a website client, so we can add/update records from the workstation as well.

The app is very simple, but do what it's supposed to do good enough. There are very few colors to organize your projects and no custom colors. You also can't synchronize between devices and there's no web version... In the end, it's simple enough to get the joh done and I still using it daily bc of that, but the lack of syncing is a huge flaw for me.

This app is increbidle! It helps me see where, when and how much time I spent on personal projects with such a easy user interface! The only (and biggest downside) is that the app dosen't sincronized between devices... I have a Android and a Chromebook and I'd like to use the app in both with sync data, but even with the PRO version I need to manually "get" the backup data...

This is the closest app to what I really need available. It's simple and easy to use. What would make it perfect for me would be the option to be able to choose the next project I'm working on when I click 'stop' on the current one (so the timer just continues running) and be able to export the data to excel. Add those features and you'll have a five star rating from me!

Design and functionality are very well done. Easy to use, clean and organized. Exactly what I needed. Thanks a lot! (Edit) There is one thing I find is missing, do you plan on making a desktop/web version of the app? That can be very convenient for some people! As right now I am using another time tracking app only because I can't keep tracking my project while working on a desktop since I turn off my phone for less distraction.

Great App! I have been using it for a while now and am convinced that it is the best designed time tracking app out there :) What I do miss a little bit is to be able to mark projects as billable so it would make my work life easier. Also I would like to be able to set "goals", so I could say I would like to work 8 hours daily, I would get notified when I reached the 8 hours. That would be really cool! :)

The app is simple and easy to use. No account is required, which is perfect for people who just want to try out the app. A few clicks could get you to start tracking time. The functions are simple yet useful. I can start using right away without learning what the functions are for. The app is project-centric but it's ok for me as I can group tasks of similar nature into a project. I do wish there is a note field so that I could type in the info of the records.

I think this app is halping me so much related to time my life. I m timing my life in every category: eat, school, reading, study, training... But in my opinion you have to add the sub-categories. For example, when I m eating it could be interesting choose if it's lunch, dinner or breakfast. Another thing that could be interesting is adding some templates of life patterns or add the voice orden connected to you phone, smart-watch or Google; in this way is simpler change from activity 1 to 2

I bought this app cause I desperately need an app to keep track of my time. but it still has a lot of room for improvement. firstly, I don't like how the menu pop up from the bottom. it's ugly and just awkward to use all around. secondly, I wish there's an option to make the timers the front page instead of the timeline thirdly, it needs widgets! this app needs to be streamlined more efficiently because i keep forgetting to use otherwise.

Great app and very simplistic. Great UI and being simplistic are the reasons I like this app. But it would be great if you add Time spent on each task too in reports section. It would be great to breakdown a project in that way! Also please allow us to sync our timer with records. For example if we are working and haven't started timer and halfway through if we do set a record, allow us to have a timer for the remaining record!

Very good app, the one time payment is a great deal, so far it's helping my get into healthy routines. The only thing I'd like made a bit easier is if there was a better way to record time for sub tasks in case you forgot to turn on the timer, although it's pretty easy to do so with the current set up. A great app, I would definitely recommend if you're trying to study and track productivity üòÅ

Loving it! Purchased the premium. I do wish for the feature of being able to see stats for a task or project on a per week basis and not just for the overall lifetime of the task. I'm tracking the same tasks mostly weekly, and it'll be more useful for me how much time I'm spending on each task weekly. At the moment I can only see the total time I'm spending on a task. Quick workaround is to create a task each time, but since it's the same set of tasks every week, so it's counterproductive.

The app is really good. The only feature I miss is proper data export; I see there is an option to make a backup on Google Drive, however, the application section of the drive is not accessible by any conventional means. Just an ability to backup/restore to the filesystem will do the job. File format is hardly relevant (json, sqlite, whatever you use), as long as it is possible to parse it.

I absolutely love this app! As a high school student, I am way more productive than I've ever been because of this treasure, letting me have a record of everything I do in each subject in such an organised manner. It was a pleasant surprise to discover that reports dating back to even a year would be available to glance back at for free, which is something almost all the other apps charge for. Hats off to the developers, this is quite a job well done!

How do you change the order of your tasks? Personally, I still use it, but I find that very simple functionality like dragging the task in a different order is not even possible. ITS NOT EVEN IN THE SETTINGS. Like I don't want to scroll through a project and than find what I need to click, I wish I could just have dragged my top 10 most important tasks and than click them as I go. I found this app useful in tracking time but there are some simple simple things that aren't part of the app

Great app with simple interface. Would be nice if we could also categorise tasks by subcategories, since for example, having one subject but multiple different assignments makes all the tasks very hard to sort through. Also would be nice to sort through tasks alphabetically or with its subcategories.

Boosted has been useful for tracking my projects and tasks over the last 2 years and I'll always recommend it. Really clean app, no ads no bugs, just sweet to use. The only reservation I have is that whenever I change a device, I have to start from scratch, so I can't really continue from where I stopped on the last device. Maybe I'll just try the premium version.

Update: Wish the app had themed icon. Deducted one star because of this. Great app for keeping track of time spent on different projects and tasks. Filling in time sheets at the end of a week is a lot easier and involves less guesswork with this app. If you forget to start the app at the beginning of a task (or forget to stop it), you can still manually edit the time.

summary: Play Music with Music Player & MP3 Player, Audio Player, Music Apps & MP3 Cutter

scraped_reviews.content: The app WAS exactly what it was supposed to be. A music player. Now it's monitoring my calls, popping up interfaces all over my screen(outside of the app and when it's not even running), and asking me for strange permissions. the frequent ads are annoying as well. I understand one ad at the beginning for the pro version, but not playing an ad right in the middle of a song..

This was the only music app I have used for several years now. And I didn't mind paying $1 a month to have the annoying ads removed. But all of a sudden, the app requires access to your phone so it can "check for viruses " after each call. And if you don't give permission, then the app is completely useless. I gave permission, and some weird screen pops up during your call and even on FaceTime. it's so annoying. It should be optional. I am canceling my subscription and finding a new music app.

Downloaded and started using this because it allowed me to create playlists over 1k songs (which Samsung player strangely was unable to do) and liked it enough to purchase the lifetime ad-free version. Loved it until a recent update now forces the app to have access to phone logs in order to use it. WHY?! You're a music player, not an app for managing phone calls! Stay in your lane, Muzio! This After Call "feature" that is required to use the app is the reason I'm looking for something else.

ive been using this app for as long as i can remember, but it's just gotten worse and worse over time. eventually, they inevitably stuffed it full of ads, and now you can't even open the app without getting through like 5 different pop-ups trying to get you to buy premium or something. sorry not sorry, it's not more convincing the more you shove it in my face. but NOW, it demands to have access to your phone calls??? inconvenient, incredibly invasive, and unnecessary. i hate it.

I paid for lifetime pro and then an update took it away asking for a LOT of money for a subscription. I had to deal with that for a while until it was fixed, with ads popping up and covering the whole UI, which meant I couldn't switch to a different song after opening up the app until I dealt with the ad. Now it won't let me use the app at all unless I allow it permission to my phone logs and there's a pop-up after every phone call with no way to get rid of it.

while I absolutely love and after ad, especially the ones you can't get out of and have to close the app down, the constant badgery of buying a subscription for music is highly annoying. Now the app is tied into my phone calls and I can't remove it so I am left with removing the app completely from my phone. You would like to think for 1K phone, you could have a simple music app strictly to play uploaded music without all the BS, but alas.... not in the cards.

No more! This was my #1 music app until I HAD to give permission for it to access my phone calls and to overlay other apps. I took one call after this was required. It wouldn't stop playing music during the call and didn't disappear after I ended the call. I'm hoping it goes away or at least make it an option. I'm using another app that doesn't require all access to everything on my phone.

Edit: GET RID OF THE DAMN PHONE CALL UPDATE. Also fix your contact email, as your contact email doesn't work. Overall a good app, but they have recently started to push ads more and more. Wouldn't be surprised if they started to play ads between songs soon at this rate. Edit: The ads have gotten so bad that I've had to go through a series of 4 ads just to open the app. Choose another player.

(UPDATE) Now the app is trying to FORCE me to give it permissions. Uninstalled. Used to be my favorite music app. I would go out of my way to make sure I had this specific app downloaded. Until a few months ago, I started noticing more and more predatory practices. Used to be able to open the app right away, now I'm forced to click on THREE tiny little X's to skip all the ads and premium service offers. It has become just another awful app on the Play Store. R.I.P.

3/27/21 needed a replacement for google play music and this is way better. 02/25 Update: When I first found this app it was perfect. No ads and overall no issues. They've decide to bombard people with ads now, its ridiculous. When the change first happened, it was fine. A single ad that you could x out of immediately would pop up when the app first opened and never again. Now ads are constant and are difficult to x out of so you need to click multiple times. Going elsewhere.

I really loved using this app to put and listen to music, but the change has really been annoying. I used to be able to access the music offline but now when I'm not connected to WiFi it takes forever to load. And not to mention, the subscription screen popping up with an ad sometimes immediately afterward. Even simply going to a playlist sometimes makes an ad pop up. It's honestly starting to remind me of those 3D games that are just ads after every single little thing you do.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, sorry for the problem, we will definitely fix it. To help us understand the problem better, could you please share the video recording or share the app logs from the settings , We are trying hard to make this app perfect for you and we will definitely fix it sooner. Thank you very much.

scraped_reviews.content: Had to go from a 5 star to 1 star. I've used this app for years cause for the longest time it was the best music player, but now you can't even click the back button without being spammed with ads on top of pummeling you asking for you to subscribe to their paid plan every time you pull the app up. So I think I'm gonna look for a different app. Also seeing reviews of people saying they paid for lifetime membership just to have it yanked away, that's bad business.

When I originally got this app, it had no ads and worked great. I used it off and on for 4 months, but when I left it alone for roughly 3 months, it started having ads afterwords. I disable Auto Update because many groups bloat or entirely re-design their apps to be worse, so make of that what you will. If you still see 3 stars on this review, then ads haven't started interrupting my music audio yet.

This app used to be my go-to. I preferred it over other free players because if the nice default themes and lack of audio ads, just occasional banners. After a while popups started creeping in, then popups with wait-times. Today the canary in the coalmine dropped. I opened the app to a paywall. Full-page spread of their $6 a week (a WEEK) ad-free service. It has no apparent way to close and ofc you need payment info to start a free trial, basically holding my playlists for ransom. Just use VLC.

Been using for years and all of a sudden, I'll open the app and it's a pop up for the subscription and I click exit than another pop up pertaining to something else than something else pops up so that's 3 times I gotta click the "x" to get to the music player. I can't deal with this anymore so I need to find another app.

This app now requires access to your phone calls, otherwise you can't access the app. After each phone call it displays advertising. I was a paid up user with supposedly no ads going forward, then they force phone call related ads. Looking to delete the app and go elsewhere. It used to be a great app. I originally gave it 5 stars but not anymore. They've already been paid for use of their app, and they didn't honor that purchase.

This was a good music app until they wanted to take control of your phone with all their permissions. And now, for no reason, 90% of all my music on all my playlists has disappeared. They've taken something that was good and made it terrible. Don't bother with this music app. Find one less intrusive, and that just plays your music.

I've been using this app for years but I finally have to drop it. The """call screening""" feature has completely ruined the app, rendering it pretty much useless, but even if you put up with it, the app itself isn't great. It lets you add music titles and albums and whatnot, but it doesn't actually edit the metadata, so when you swap devices, you have to add all of the data back. Also, because of the ads, if you don't have data or a strong connection you might just not be able to open the app.

I thought I'd configured my phone app wrong when Muzio started popping up after EVERY CALL out of nowhere! Sometimes, before I could even end the call properly! Yeah, that's EXACTLY what I wanted from my audio player, thanks! üôÑ You had it all, Muzio! You could have been THAT ONE APP but you just couldn't help yourselves. I leave you with two stars (a year ago, it would have been five without hesitation!) hopeful you'll turn this train wreck around before you do permanent damage.

05/04/21 Best music app ever!!!! 09/27/25 What the hell happened to this app? Can't even use it unless I give weird permissions from my phone. There's always a pop up after every call, either missed, answered or dialed. It's just so annoying. The music player doesn't work unless you enable this permission. Used to be the best player in in the app store. Simple music player with some extras added. Bought the pro/full version years ago so I, it was a blast. Not anymore üòí

Don't waste your time. Not worth downloading anymore. I have used this app for years to listen to downloaded music and loved it. Now the app forces you to give it access to phone calls to be able to be used. if this feature was optional I wouldn't care and just leave it off, but no. I used to give it access just to get in and then remove it immediately afterwards and the app wouldnt refresh, but that's exhausting to do every time. I'm looking for a new free music player.

Holy hell the ads are out of control. This app used to just have some unobtrusive banner ads, but now anytime I want to quickly open it to skip a song or something I have to wait for an unskippable 30 second ad to play (along with their gross habit of "skip, but here's the link. skip the link but here's a screenshot of the store page" so it's more like a minute long ad).

It was great until it required permission to access phone calls. I had even bought the lifetime access a couple years ago. But now, If you don't grant it permission to access your phone, you get stuck in the set up screen with no way around it. Once you grant the permission, it has annoying popups on the call screen you can't get rid of even in video calls. And when you end the call, it opens the app in a useless screen even if the app wasn't running before. I am currently looking for a new app.

Wow. Where do I start? I've been using this cool music app for maybe 5-7 years now. I have thousands of songs in my personal library. Well, it has become almost intolerable to use. Every finger press has become a pop-up ad that lingers way too long and can be very difficult to remove. This latest update has been awful ! The ads are DESTROYING YOUR APP. You are pissing all of us off !!! Now, the repeat functions are NOT WORKING. I press "play all" but it stops playing after ONE SONG. Awful.

putting my star lower to 2 from 5. it's worse than YouTube for adds. they Blair out interrupting your music and ask for a weekly payment. if be fine paying a one time fee. but this adds and subscription stuff is out of touch with reality. I'll be looking for a new less intrusive music player. open music add, click a song, add. oh don't even reply with "we need adds to be free" you also won't offer a better payment plan last I looked.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We want you to have the best user experience! That's why we'll share your feedback with the developers, who will take it into account. However, please consider increasing your rating to help us continue to maintain and support the app.

scraped_reviews.content: it was good until the pop-ups. They have became hard to get rid of for me when I'm driving. they just pop up if my phone screen is on and on the app while switching songs. it's not good if I have to press x while I'm driving just to get rid of the ad. I understand that ads are a necessary part to keep free, but I would suggest some other way to display ads without interrupting the music or some other way that won't disrupt the music.

I've been using Muzio for years; however, they now demand access to your phone settings on Android with no way to turn it off. If you don't provide access you can't use Muzio. There is no reason or need for an audio player to have full access to your phone, including logs. The screen at the end of every phone call, even if it's a missed or screened phone call, is extremely invasive and intrusive. Now I have to find a new music player, since I'll be deleting this app.

Been using this app for years but their recent change of making it a requirement to give access to your phone calls killed it for me. There is absolutely no reason for a music app to have access to your calls. On top of that, they made it very intrusive to your UI when calls happen. Unless they revert this change, your better off finding a different music player. Truly a shame.

Loved the app until it started to (Demand) permission to my phone calls. I say demand because if you don't give it permission, the app is useless. Also, there are too many ads at too many inconvenient times. Ads while in the middle of a song, or why you're trying to navigate to a another song. I was super pleased until now. Very disappointed.

I LOVED this app. And then, like others, I was put off by the app suddenly requiring permission to manage phone calls and display over my screen. I get the reason for these permissions, but there is absolutely no reason these can't be optional. I can pause my own music if I decide to pick up a phone call, and I don't need my music app displaying over anything. My phone is off 80% of the time I'm listening to music, and I'm playing games I need the full screen for the other 20%.

Betrayal! This was my favorite music player. I paid for a premium, no ads account a while back. Suddenly that's gone and they're trying to extort a $6 per month subscription! And shoving full screen ads at me. Total breach of contract. update: they stopped with the ads for a few months, which was great but then demanded permission to manage phone calls. I finally relented but it was awful. every phone call the app opens and blocks the screen! So I removed the permission and now it won't open.

no idea how you mess up an audio player. my phone didn't come with one so I've been using this garbage for years. it had small ads at the bottom when I started. weird but sure whatever, not too intrusive. later they added ads whenever you open the app. ok that's a bit ridiculous for accessing my own music but sure. now they ask for phone call access. that was the last straw for me I don't know who these people think they are, when there are already countless ad free options. just install foobar

I've been using this app for a long time, but now they're requiring access to my phone. At first I allowed it. You know what happened? The app opened up at the end of every phone call, which was annoying. What really ended our relationship immediately was when the app displayed DURING the phone call, which was an issue when I was on speaker phone trying to navigate my phone and take notes at the same time. The app covers the keys so I can't click on the screen. That was an immediate no from me.

VERY INVASIVE... Used Muzio for years, did a good job, had a couple nice features. It was good until a recent update now requires me to give access to phone logs to "check for potential viruses after calls" as per their permission message... You cannot use the app unless you hand over these permissions, and if I wanted a virus scanning software, I wouldn't want it from my MP3 player ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

I used to love this app. I paid $9 fornit a few years ago. I teach fitness classes, and the Playlist feature was great. BUT this new "feature " where you HAVE to allow access to calls, or the music won't play IS HORRID. I mean, absolutely trash. I dont want an add every time I get a call, ESPECIALLY since I paid for it.

I'm changing my review for this app. I used to love this but I've found the ad increase annoying. luckily I used my phone exclusively for music and emulation and don't have service on it unless I'm connected to wifi. thus no ads. the reason I changed my review is cause this app forces full access to my phone. why? that is very invasive. a music app doesn't need this access. nice work killing off your app. üòë this app is at the end of its life span. time to find another.

im done. i tried to stay with this app but i just can't. a majority of the time i listen to music in my car. the constant bombardment of ads and having to look for how to cancel them has taken its toll. Not to mention the completely unnecessary permissions required for it to work. Just to hear my own damn music??? My whole family is ditching. Do better üòí

used to be a great app. now it just sucks. if you don't want to pay $5.99 a WEEK (and who does? ü§î) you have to deal with BS ads every time you click or tap something in the app. just to shuffle my playlist I had to watch 3 ads back to back. far as I'm concerned this app doesn't deserve 5 stars let alone the one, but I couldn't figure out how to delete it soo...

Five years after giving this a 5 star review, I'm changing my review to 1 star. I've been happily paying for the yearly subscription, but am looking for something different, music player that doesn't need access to my phone logs. Why does a music player need that kind of access? It didn't need it before and it certainly doesn't need it now. I'll not be renewing my subscription and am looking for an alternative.

Every since the last two updates I'm no longer able to use the app. It keeps coming up saying that I need to allow it permissions to appear on top and to send notifications. I enable it all and it still doesn't work. üò° I've used this app for years and have loved it. At this point it's useless. I DO NOT RECOMMEND DOWNLOADING IT!!!

Just like the other reviews, I have used this app forever, now all of a sudden it won't let me use it without access to my phone and it sucks! Every call is unknown and it puts a big second box across the screen with an ad running! After all these years I have to find a new app if they don't change it soon! There is absolutely no reason for them to have access to your phone calls

PHONE PERMISSIONS!!! Latest update, this app is requesting phone app permissions in order to function. DUMB. I need a music app, that's it. Managed to bypass this feature. First, open your app, follow steps to allow phone permissions. Select a track to play. Then, open all apps in Settings. Find app, unselect phone permissions. Your track will stop playing. Just go back and play again. There's no permanent solution, and if you close app, you'll have to do it again. A minor inconvenience.

Been using Muzio since about 2021 and have loved it until now. Now it requires me to let it appear over my apps after I receive a phone call. This is so it can put its overlay that not only interrupts anything I was doing before the call, but also changes what I was listening to the first song in my downloads. Not only that, I paid so I would not see ads on Muzio. This overlay has ads that I cannot get rid of.

This app WAS okay. It did what I needed which was to make playlists and had a simple enough interface. Ads weren't an issue at first but they added video ads with a skip timer which was a nightmare while driving. I draw the line at their latest update which requires a call overlay. The app won't even be in use and all calls and texts will create an overlay. I don't want a call/text app; I want a music player! You CANNOT use this app now without that turned on.

so when this app first came out it was great! I meant my five stars it was how I listened to audiobooks. I recommend it to people! NOT ANYMORE!! I get you have to deal with ads it sucks but it is whatever. BUT THERE IS NO REASON A MUSIC PLAYER NEEDS TO SCREEN MY CALLS! I deleted it off my phone off my wife's phone and will highly recommend any other app but this one now.

I occasionally go through spells where I don't use the app for long periods of time and I swear every time I reopen it, it just gets increasingly worse. Last time it was being bombarded with ads. Now I can't even use the app unless I give it permission to monitor my calls. It's a music app. What business do you have scanning my phone calls for "viruses"? It used to be a decent mp3 player app. It did what it was supposed to. Don't know what compelled you to jack it up this badly.

Like a LOT of other people, I installed this years ago and liked it enough to buy the ad-free version, mostly to support the creators. A couple years later they switched to a subscription service and if you already paid for the full version you were just out of luck. A few months later they stopped the subscription service and as of late have decided to make their money by selling A LOT of user information. They collect and sell the user's location, contacts, phone logs, and more. Very sketchy.

Used this for years, it used to be great. I don't need anything fancy to listen to my music I just need some place to make playlists and this was perfect. But the update with a feature where you NEED to have muzio access your phone is too much.On top of being annoying getting a popup whenever a call ends it can be dangerous if you're driving and need maps up but you get a popup. I'm not going to always get off the road(sometimes you can't or there's no stop)to exit it and re-enter my navigation.

Used to be perfectly fine and good but the current version forces you to allow access to your calls so they can "check for viruses" after you receive a call, which prompts an annoying and useless screen to pop up after every call you receive even if you aren't listening to your music. You can disable the app's phone access once you get past the initial screen that forces you to but you will have to turn it on again if the app is reset. Huge downgrade and I will be looking for an alternative now.

would of been a 5 star, but the new update where I have to allow access to phone calls is annoying. when someone calls when I'm not using it the pop up for incoming call pops up thru the app and my phone and I then have to go into settings to turn off permissions for the app because I'm not using it. I only use the app to listen to my music. if you guys can get rid of that feature that would be great, but other than that great app I've been using it for a few yrs very easy to use.

title: CNN: Live & Breaking News
description:
The CNN app is your destination for unrivaled, fact-based reporting. Stay informed at every turn as the story breaks through short-form videos, interactives, articles, podcasts, live audio and more. Easily discover the day's top news from politics, health, world news, climate and beyond.

Download the CNN app to start making sense of the world today.

START STREAMING THE CNN EXPERIENCE TODAY.
Now watch unlimited streaming, including 24/7 global news, daily programs from trusted journalists, award-winning shows and films, and more.

FOLLOW LIVE UPDATES.
Set custom alerts and notifications so you can follow developing stories. Our "live update" articles evolve as the news comes in, giving you accurate updates as they happen.

WATCH THE STORY UNFOLD.
See it for yourself with CNN‚Äôs live video or be in the know quickly with CNN Shorts.

STAY SHARP WITH EXPERT INSIGHTS.
Delivering in-depth analysis and context that matters from award-winning journalists, so you're prepared for what's next.

DIVE DEEPER WITH LIVE REPORTING.
Enjoy a 5-minute preview of CNN live. Unlock unlimited viewing, including CNN's original series and documentary collection, CNN, CNN International, and HLN by logging into your TV provider. Stay caught up with video clips, no login necessary.

TAKE A BREAK.
From travel and style news to the latest in entertainment, discover feel-good stories and get a daily dose of positivity.

LISTEN TO STAY CONNECTED.
Listen to top headlines anywhere you go with live audio from CNN, CNN en Espa√±ol, CNN International and HLN. Hear the week's biggest and most talked-about stories with the "1 Thing" podcast.
 
DIGITAL SUBSCRIPTION (Available in the United States)
All Access plan - The premium CNN experience: streaming, exclusive videos, articles, and more.
‚Ä¢ 24/7 global news
‚Ä¢ Live coverage
‚Ä¢ Exclusive videos
‚Ä¢ Original series
‚Ä¢ Award-winning films
‚Ä¢ Unlimited articles

Basic plan - The basic CNN experience
‚Ä¢ Unlimited articles

Your subscription will automatically renew at the then-current price of your plan unless you cancel at least 24 hours before the renewal. Your App Store account will automatically be charged at the same price for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of your current subscription period. You can manage your subscription by visiting the Google Play Store or under Settings on your Android device.

scraped_reviews.content: This used to be a great app but not anymore. Now everything is hidden behind a pay wall. And I mean everything. Not a single article for free. CNN is not worth paying for in my opinion, especially when they still serve ads with a subscription. Apparently advertisements as well as tracking and selling my data wasn't enough money for them. Now they want to do that plus charge money. 2 stars since the app itself is good if you want to pay.

I am very disappointed in cnn. you took a great app that was free, so I could read the news, and now you want me to pay for a subscription. I'm uninstalling the app, and removing you from my tv viewing as well. I'll go elsewhere for my news. I always thought you were the best and fairest news,and certainly the most comprehensive. but not if I can't read it. goodbye and good luck ...from a former loyal customer.

I've had the CNN app installed for over 14 years without any problems. 5 star rating until a few days ago. The terms apparently updated a few weeks ago and now limits certain (all) articles to subscribers and blocks them when you try to read them. The only option presented is to pay $30 a month. Uninstalled a couple minutes ago and downloaded NBC. Really let me down CNN. The least you could have done was placed ads and let me continue to read on. But such is the way of loyalty I suppose.

The app itself not to bad. Has plenty to read on. But when it comes to the listen feature. It's trash. About 3 mins of content and 10 mins of the same ads over and over. And almost everytime I use it(which is alot) sometimes the transmission just cuts out and straight to an adult. Or ad cuts out and straight to the middle of a broadcast. Very close to deleting. If I can find an alternative.

Loved this app and used it for years but a few days ago they started pay-walling some articles and then today I noticed they pay-walled all articles (you only get one for free), so promptly deleted it and will not use it again unless they remove the subscription needed. There's loads of other websites I can get my news from for free, so goodbye! A shame really because they had a lot of good content, but it's just not worth it, especially since EVERYTHING is expensive right now.

Longtime user (at least 10 years) has now deleted the app. I typically scrolled through at least 3x per day. Recently, it seems as if most of the articles I click on to read are locked behind a damn paywall. I will NEVER pay to read these articles. EDIT FOR UPDATE: It now seems that you only get a limited number of "free articles" before EVERYTHING is locked behind the paywall. This app is literally useless now unless you're enough of a sucker to pay. I'm not & have now deleted the app.

used to love my CNN app. However, big corporate greed has ruined the app. I used to read the articles, and only certain ones required subscription access. now I can't read anything unless I pay a monthly subscription fee. the subscription doesn't include any live views, so really? I have to pay now to get my favorite news reports. I feel cheated, if you want me to pay a subscription fee, add at least live feeds or something, but I'm not paying for access I had for free just a week ago.

Another dissatisfied 10+ year user deleting the app because 100% of articles became paywalled after reading like 5 articles. Y'all get my data, profit off of showing me ads, and you still have the balls to try to charge me $30. That's not how this game works. The final straw was wanting to click on a hurricane map to see if my family was in the path, but nope, potential life saving information requires a subscription. On to a competitor.

I used to like this app, but I am seriously considering deleting it now. It says that it is free, but when you open a story that you want to read, it blocks you and tells you that they now are requiring a subscription. üò° ! I have had this app for many years, and without warning, this happened üò≥ I tried deleting it and reinstalling it, that worked for about a day. üò§ Also, I haven't read a single article today and it says I have reach my free article limit! WTH!

I used to like this app. It used to work perfectly. Now the videos won't load. I went to YouTube to make sure it was not an internet issue but that loaded immediately. Also if I'm reading an article and I get called out of it for some reason such as a text or a phone call, I cannot pick up where I left off. When I go to my open apps it starts all over from the beginning of the new feed and then I have to find the article that I was previously reading. Only 500 characters to complain!!!

Several times a day it will not load. Uninstalling and reinstalling fixes it for a few hours. After finishing an article and backing out, it goes to the top of page rather than staying where you were reading. These and other problems have been reported for a long time, but no fixes. Fox, NYT, WP and others don't have these issues.

It was a 5 no problems at all now suddenly the last couple of weeks I can't get in so it's a 1 - useless. I receive a message saying "Unknown error try again". Tried all the usual solutions - uninstalled and reinstalled, turned then phone off and on, I even talked with my internet provider and they said it's definately the app. Are you going to fix it?

I appreciate I can get reliable news at any time without a subscription fee. However, the ads play before nearly every video clip and are so extremely repetitive it gets maddening. Also, when I accidentally get taken into the "Live" TV section, when the time runs out, I'm unable to get back to the site. I have to turn off my phone, then on again to get to any other CNN story or any other application.

Like others have indicated, since the last update I have been unable to use the app. I keep getting an "Unexpected error" message and am told to "try again." I have gone as far as uninstalling and reinstalling the app, which worked...once. Guess I will have to read my morning headlines elsewhere until the problem is fixed. Pixel 3.

I used to love this app and the notifications and emails I got all day to update on the latest news. Like others, when you open the app, it's a black screen with a logo and you have to force close it and try 2 or 3 times to reload. This is annoying and cumbersome for something that used to be so simple. Additionally, I have stopped getting email alerts entirely since the last update despite checking and resaving my email preferences via the app and the website. C'mon CNN .... what happened??

Notifications don't come through. I have them all on and I don't get a single notification until I open the app, then suddenly I'll get literal dozens at a time. If I got for more than a week without opening the app, once I finally do it gives me so many notifications it crashes my phone. Sounds like not many others have this issue, but it's very tiresome.

I would like to be able to listen to live broadcasts without having to stream the video with the screen having to be on. It kills my battery and wastes data. I've suggested this a while back in 2018 but nobody listens. When i'm at work, I want to listen to the c n n app and your broadcasts on my headphones. My phone would be in my case. About 1 minute later, the broadcast stops playing in my headphones until I take the phone out of my case, illuminate the screen, and hit play again. Fix it!!!

Impossible to watch. I get alerts all day & when I finally try to follow one to a live feed, I get 8 minutes remaining of "free preview" (?), which counts down by the second through 4 minutes of 11 (ELEVEN) ads. Seriously? You expect me to watch 4+ minutes of ads to get the remaining 4 minutes of content? You need to talk to somebody about what apps are for.

I use CNN Go on my FireTV. But the app occasionally crashes, and it always seems to be when I'm in the middle of a show. This wouldn't be as infuriating if the app would have some way of keeping track of my progress in shows that I'm watching, like other TV apps. But it doesn't. So when the app crashes, I'm forced to start my show from the beginning. And fast-forward doesn't really help because I can only fast-forward through the program and not the ads.

It won't even load when you open it. It might load after a minute or never. I've uninstalled and reinstalled several times but to no avail. Repost: It's done this for months now. It may open in 20 seconds or never. I've never had a problem with any app not opening... Now that it finally opened last night for me...don't get too excited. It won't close. Now I have to uninstall again. Today, won't open again. I have hundreds of apps. They all open except this one.

This used to be a good, data-friendly alternative to the auto-play video hell of the CNN website. Used to be. I deleted it right after an HD video ad played in an article. Not in a video, IN AN ARTICLE. It was impossible to stop, and apparently continued to play even when it wasn't on screen. The result? That one video ad used ONE THIRD of my data for the month. DO NOT USE THIS APP IF YOU HAVE DATA LIMITS!

Edit-2: After latest update it is working again. Still too many videos and not enough articles. Edit: I shouldn't have complained, now the app no longer works at all. Just shuts down with unknown error. Guess I need to switch to MSNBC or Fox news. Great collection of news articles, but I want to read the news and not only watch videos.

Reached my monthly free article limit on the first thing I've clicked on June 1st? This is complete BS. And even more ridiculous to charge those of us with cable subscriptions that include the CNN channel, the app literally shows my cable provider in the settings. Plus, I have a Max subscription too. Either of those should get unlimited access to this app but CNN decided greed was the way. Never paying individually for this app. This will surely go as swimmingly as CNN Plus did.

4* for news. But 1* because it does not exit when you use the back button. The cnn app opens when you click on CNN news in a browser ( don't want it to ). And the app doesn't exit when you hit back. News. I like the live audio only option on the front page. Handy during car drives. BUT it does not work on my pixel 4a 5g via bluetooth. All the other usual audio and music apps work ok.

Recently this app will not open to the stories for which I get notifications. It goes to the main menu. I don't want to then have to search for the story. This was a dumb update. Also, app will not close anymore with back button. Must force close. Not putting me into the requested story and then making me force close has started the habit of looking at other news sources first. These are not great updates, CNN. Get it together.

App keeps crashing while watching live video. Gets stuck in mini window when going to commercial, need to close and start live video again every time. Video starts muted with no option to change it. This app becomes more terrible every day. update: nothing changed, still sucks

This is supposed to be a very good news source, but I had to disable all of its functions in my security settings for this app. No wifi access. No data access, no background activity, and no permissions, not even notifications. I found that everything disabled the notifications and background battery was still active. The notifications were still sending popups. Some software is targeted to turn these functions back on unexpectedly on your device. Be weary.

I'm about ready to cancel my subscription for this app since it keeps saying I need to subscribe even though I have a subscription and have signed into my account. Resetting and reinstalling the app has made no difference and it still asks me to subscribe after signing into my account. I shouldn't have to pay a subscription to access news in the first place and the fact that the app is broken for your paying customers shows how little CNN cares about them.

Love the new UX but unfortunately all the news articles now require paid subscription. I don't mind ads, but to take free articles and make them paid eliminates a trusted source. I can't even read a few articles a day before getting locked out. Uninstalling this app. the news is frustrating enough without also being blocked from reading it

Since CNN got greedy, (iykyk) I now only open the app to listen to nightly broadcasts while cooking dinner, but now the greedy only allows ~15 mins of audio with 50% of it advertising, so I really only get ~ 7 mins of content before it stops. Can't press play to restart, instead, I've got to exit the broadcast and re-select it to continue. I'm switching to AP for news, it's free and ads pre-video are <15 seconds! CNN was my fav news source for 40 yrs, until greed turned it into trash!

seems every top story at the top of the app today is "member exclusive". though it does not say that before you tap on the story. why you're putting member only articles at the top is beyond me. that only makes me close out the app entirely and go on with my day. just deleted. just about every story to us for subscribers. sad day when the news starts charging people for it.

after an unsuccessful sign up for the new subscription service, CNN support told me to reinstall the application. now I can no longer connect with my TV provider for live tv. this app is getting worse. stay away!

This used to be my go-to app for news but I'm considering uninstalling it because every single article I click now has an alert that I've run out of "free articles" and have to pay to subscribe. Whatever happened to the good old days of my data being payment enough? All those stats you have on me, my phone, how much time I spend in the app, how often I open it - is that not worth anything any longer? Forget it CNN, you're not getting money out of me.

Longtime reader, this was my main source for news. Then half the articles were videos instead of reading, so I just avoided them. Now the last nail in the coffin, hitting a constant paywall. What a shame, it was a decent news app.

This used to be a great app but it has never been worth paying for. I have had it for over a decade and now I don't even look at it. I haven't uninstalled it yet because I hope they come to their senses and reverse the paywall. I only read my news. I do not watch it on TV with the rare exception of catching the local forecast on the local news channel from time to time. The paywall has ruined what used to be a good app.

I used to read articles on here but now everything is behind a subscription pay wall. I could understand paying for the videos but not editorials. Not sure which greedy a-hole at CNN corporate decided this but it's killed this app for me.
CNN has been helpful for quick global updates and live coverage. I like how fast it reports major events and the range of topics it covers ‚Äî reliable and accessible.
All access is actually half access. The live stream is SD on google tv not HD. Also CNN app does not allow to chromecast the live stream . Very frustrating.

It would be a lot better if they included articles to go all with the video clips instead of just clips. A 2.5 min video communicates significantly less information than 2.5 mins of reading. Also there are still ads even if you are a paid subscriber

The app is good in the sense that the stories are uploaded frequently and organized. However CNN in general shows a very strong bias to more leftist leaning readers and writers. I would give it 5 stars if only it was more neutral.

I like the app in general but the fact that so many articles they push are behind paywalls is getting frustrating. Lowered my rating to 2 stars because you apparently only get a limited amount of free articles a month then it's ALL behind the paywall. No thank you, plenty of other free news services.

Ensh**ification ruins another good product. Notifications and material was really good. Now as other's say it's all locked behind a paywall and I only ever got the "you've reached your monthly limit" warning, even if it was the start of the month. Ended up deleting it and getting my news from a competitor instead.

People should NOT have to pay for information, you are part of the problem. Have a feature to Disable 'For Subscribers' Push Notifications. The search engine is inaccurate and doesn't find what you're searching for. How the app organizes articles/stories is very bad üëé The widget doesn't like to reload and it doesn't work on cellular network, it only works on Wi-Fi, that needs to be fixed. Also, the photos from articles barely show on the widget. Cnn Live barely works.

Its been bad with ads galore and links to products buy, but now they want me to subscribe to read their stories? No thanks. The same content is available elsewhere. Its a bait and switch app. Click on a headline and then told you have to be a subscriber. Remove the advertising and I'll but the app.

This app is a great way to stay updated with the latest news. It‚Äôs easy to use and gives you quick access to breaking stories, videos, and live TV. News updates all day. Watch live CNN and short clips.

By making people pay to read stories on an app that used to be free to read stories and now you're charging them? I will not be using this app anymore to read stories. There's politico there's MSNBC there's NBC News there's CBS News and they all don't make you pay to read stories so I'll be using one of those apps to read news. There's really no point in getting breaking news alerts from this app if I have to pay to read the stories.
I paid for a subscription. why force me to watch an anoying add each time I open the app. at least, give us a chance to shut it up!
Far too many articles require a subscription. There is not enough original reporting to justify any cost. You can find plenty of related articles about a topic for free elsewhere.

Placing your stories behind a paywall is a disservice to the individuals who use your platform to get the news. Depriving people who can't afford another subscription from the news will lead them to find other options, probably in the form of podcast and tiktoks, which may be riddled with misinformation.
Good App, Not Paying Though. This has been my go to app for quick news updates for years. I see commercials, there's your revenue. Don't hit me with a paywall also. Uninstalling.
